instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
water damage in the area of J8300, connector had blown pins 3 and 4, replaced connector and components around it. still no power to Pin 3/4
i have 8.6V to pin 1 of F7700, C7712 is .0V

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message: Did you check if the fuse is blown? Diode mode on backlight output?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
What voltage is on L7701, pin 1 and 2?

What voltage is on D7701, pin 1 and 2?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
Is there even image?
Do you get USB activity, or chime?
Assuming yes, or at least DP_INT_HPD is high, post voltages at Q7700.
Check continuity to R5490.
Corroded XW7720 is common failure on Airs...

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 38796"]What voltage is on L7701, pin 1 and 2?

What voltage is on D7701, pin 1 and 2? [/QUOTE]

L7701 pin 1 .06v and pin 2 .20V
D7701 Pin 1 .20v and pin 2 .15v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 38811"]Is there even image?
Do you get USB activity, or chime?
Assuming yes, or at least DP_INT_HPD is high, post voltages at Q7700.
Check continuity to R5490.
Corroded XW7720 is common failure on Airs...[/QUOTE]

i have faint image, USB works and i get chime
Q7700 all pins less than .10v
R5490 is blank 
and XW7720 is corroded but i think there is a problem before this (but i did run jumper and tested continuity to pin 5 of U7701)

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
Sorry, my mistake; it should be Q7706, instead of Q7700...
As no voltage at L7701, check F7700 and post Q7706/07 voltages.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 38942"]Sorry, my mistake; it should be Q7706, instead of Q7700...
As no voltage at L7701, check F7700 and post Q7706/07 voltages.
[/QUOTE]

no worries, thank you for helping.
Q7706
pin 1 .01v
pin 2 3.3v
pin 3 .02v
pin 4  .01v
pin 5 3.3v
pin 6 .01v

F7700 pin 1 8.6v and pin 2 .01v

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
"F7700 pin 1 8.6v and pin 2 .01v"
F7700 blown, change it...

Be sure no short on backlight area, before power up the board.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 38945"]"F7700 pin 1 8.6v and pin 2 .01v"
F770 blown, change it...

Be sure no short on backlight area, before power up the board.[/QUOTE]

ok thank you

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-00165 No Backlight
threads.message: Replaced filter and problem solved thank you
